name: Composite
description: The CM data type is a generic composite data type used in HL7 v2.3 as a placeholder for complex field definitions that were later replaced by more specific composite data types in subsequent HL7 versions. CM fields typically contain multiple related data elements separated by component separators, but the specific structure varies by field and implementation. This data type has been largely superseded by more precisely defined composite types in later HL7 versions.

CM.1.name: Component 1
CM.1.description: First component of the composite field. The specific meaning and data type depend on the field where CM is used.

CM.2.name: Component 2
CM.2.description: Second component of the composite field. Content varies based on specific field implementation.

CM.3.name: Component 3
CM.3.description: Third component of the composite field. Additional components may be present depending on field requirements.

constraints.fieldSpecific: Actual structure depends on the specific field where CM is used
constraints.variableLength: Number of components varies by implementation and field requirements
constraints.deprecated: CM has been replaced by more specific composite types in later HL7 versions
